qas.question: Why would a black-looking Arab consider himself white?

answers.text: because they have some distant white ancestry.

qas.question: Where does Dr. Carlos Moore work?

answers.text: Brazil's University of the State of Bahia

qas.question: How do Afro-multiracials identify in the 21st century?

context: According to Dr. Carlos Moore, resident scholar at <a1_0>Brazil's University of the State of Bahia<a1_0/>, in the 21st century Afro-multiracials in the Arab world, including Arabs in North Africa, self-identify <a2_0>in ways that resemble multi-racials<a2_0/> in Latin America. He claims that black-looking Arabs, much like black-looking Latin Americans, consider themselves white <a0_0>because they have some distant white ancestry.
